pr_title: HADOOP-17234. Add .asf.yaml to allow Github to Jira integration.

timeline.message: HADOOP-17234. Add .asf.yaml to allow Github to Jira integration.
HADOOP-17234. Add .asf.yaml to allow Github to Jira integration.

timeline.bodyText: nit: do we need newline at the end of file?
timeline.author: liuml07
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,25 @@

+
+github:
+  enabled_merge_buttons:
+    squash: true
+    merge: false
+    rebase: false
+notifications:
+  commits:      common-commits@hadoop.apache.org
+  issues:       common-issues@hadoop.apache.org
+  pullrequests: common-issues@hadoop.apache.org
+  jira_options: link label worklog

replies.bodyText:
The link was added by me only. But I got this checked from the Infra team on the asfInfra slack channel and they only told, post this things should work.
Regarding the newline, I don't know if it is required, Most of the files don't have it. If you say I will push a commit adding one
slack response
replies.author: ayushtkn

replies.bodyText:
No it's not required. It's not a blank line newline, but a hidden char. Sharing some thoughts:

No end of line char can lead to unexpected behavior when using other tools on the file. For e.g. git diff or external diff tools depend on newlines to generate a correct diff. wc command counting lines may also be broken. More can be found at this discussion.
Next time when someone edits the file, some editors will automatically add a "newline" char at the end of this file - for good intention. If so, seems like they "changed" the last line of this file in their PR which they do not.

But that is not a real problem here. We can commit without fixing that, I'm fine with that.
replies.author: liuml07
